description: Made by Hama, assisted by Ranthalos and Metor w/ technical stuff
name: Part 2.1: Basic PvE Weapon rolls to look for

data.description: Solid Pulse for Kinetic Slot and with a pretty high zoom you can reach pretty far with this. Arrowhead / Fluted are preferred Barrels and Accurized / Flared for Mags. Heating Up is a pretty solid combination with Frenzy, but you can also opt into Feeding Frenzy and Surplus along with Adren Junkie or Rampage. My preference is HU + Frenzy though. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.
data.name: Legal Action II

data.description: You can get some crazy ranged with this gun, but lacks in perks. SRO-41 Ocular and SRO-37 will allow you to hit for 40m+. Flared and Tac Mag is the go to Mags here and Outlaw is the only good option in your 3rd column. Your go to damage perks are Kill Clip and Rampage, which is somewhat lackluster. My preference is on Kill Clip though. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Last Perdition

data.description: I prefer Arrowhead here and Fluted as my 2nd choice. Ideally you'd go for Flared, but Tac Mag or Accurized also works. Heating Up is my go to, but Surplus and Subsistence also work and is down to preference. Multikill Clip is a solid damage option, but Adren Junkie works for people who spec into nade builds. I'm not too big of a fan of Rampage, but is also usable. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Scathelocke

data.description: I spent so much time grinding this gun... Ignition Code can roll both Ambitious Assassin and Slideshot which are both very fun perks to mess around with. Hard Launch is my go to Barrel with Spikes, but Quick Launch is also solid. Slideshot enables you to reload by simply doing that, sliding, but Ambitious Assassin is the more conventional use choice. Vorpal for damage and Demo for Nade builds. Recommended MW: Velocity.
data.name: Ignition Code

data.description: Ignition Code also have some flexible choice when it comes to Blinding Grenades as you can opt into either Slideshot for a fast reload or Quickdraw to always have it ready. Quick Launch / Smart Drift is my go to Barrels and Danger Zone increases the Blinding Nade radius by 3m when procced, but if you're not a fan of Danger Zone you can always opt into Vorpal or Demo. Recommended MW: Velocity.
data.name: Ignition Code

data.description: DPS Version Adept only requires Tactical Mag with Adept Backup Mag
data.name: Uzume RR4 (Adept)

data.description: Casual use version
data.name: Uzume RR4 (Adept)

data.description: Auto-Loading and Lasting Impression is solid for DPS. Quick Launch and Smart Drift are your go to barrels and you'll want Impact Casing as Mag, but Black Powder is also fine. Some people don't like how Lasting Impression can feel unreliable for bosses that go immune, but this is down to preference. Recommended MW: Handling.
data.name: Tomorrow's Answer

data.description: A Wave Frame with pretty lackluster rolls, but still works. Quick Launch / Smart Drift is preferred and as usual you opt into High Velocity Rounds. Ambitious Assassin is very good on Special GL's, but unfortunately there's no good perks to pair it with so you're opting into Rampage or Auto-Loading. Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload.
data.name: Deafening Whisper

data.description: Solid all around Fusion. Feeding Frenzy and Reservoir Burst is amazing for general ad control and makes this Fusion feel really good in general. Arrowhead and Fluted are preferred Barrels and you'd want Liquid Coils to increase the chances of killing something with Reservoir Burst, but Accelerated is fine too if you prefer that. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.
data.name: Plug One.1

data.description: Honestly, I mostly consider Compulsive Reloader to be a meme roll, but paired with Reservoir Burst I guess this is the only possible use case for it right now. Even then I'd rather just have Feeding Frenzy or Heating Up. Arrowhead / Fluted and Liquid / Accelerated (Preference). Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.
data.name: Plug One.1

data.description: A Pulse Rifle that is sadly outmatched by other options in PvE. Arrowhead and Fluted are your go to options for Barrel and High Cal / Ricochet Rounds are your go to Mags. Feeding Frenzy and Multikill Clip are basically your only 3rd and 4th column options here. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Cold Denial

data.description: Fun Sword to mess around with. Chain Reaction on a Caster frame is interesting and allows for some fun in casual content. Vorpal is also decent here. Jagged Edge is preferred, but Honed works too. Swordmaster's Guard is preferred, but as long as you're avoiding Heavy Guard you're fine. The choice between Tireless and Relentless Blade will vary, but for the most part I'd say go for Tireless. Recommended MW: Impact.
data.name: Sola's Scar

data.description: While not having the best combination of rolls, this is a Pulse that I personally really like. Heating Up paired with Frenzy feels very good. Arrowhead / Fluted are your preferred Barrels and you'll want High-Cal / Armor Piercing / Light Mag for your Mag. Armor Piercing helps for Match Game content, while the others are more general use. Heating Up is your best 3rd column perk, while you can opt for either Multikill Clip, Adren Junkie or Frenzy for your damage perk. My preference is Frenzy. Recommended MW: Range or Reload.
data.name: Gridskipper

data.description: Fluted Barrel feels very necessary here to help the gun feel better, but Smallbore / Corkscrew also works. Flared / Tac Mag helps push the Reload faster, but Accurized if Frenzy. Dynamic Sway Reduction makes this gun feel a lot better to use and is my preferred roll for 3rd column. Outlaw also works though. Frenzy and Multikill Clip are your damage options, my preference being Frenzy. Demo is also okay for Nade builds. Recommended MW: Range or Reload.
data.name: Chrysura Melo

data.description: This gun has potential for build crafting. Truesight and Steadyhand is your go to Sights and you can use either Accurized or Flared for Mags depending on what you want. Demo is one of your core perks in the 3rd column and with this you can either opt into a Nade focused build with Adren Junkie or you can mess around with Osmosis if you want. Recommended MW: Range or Reload.
data.name: Judgment

data.description: Mostly just a fun roll for Ad clear with Chain Reaction. Hard Launch / Quick Launch are your preferred Barrels and you can use thi with either Clown or Auto-Loading. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload.
data.name: Memory Interdict

data.description: A solid Rapid Fire Fusion. Red Dot Micro is your 1st choice of Sight and Red Dot 2 MOA is your 2nd best option. Liquid / Accelerated Coils is mostly preference, but in this case I prefer Liquid. Feeding Frenzy and Vorpal are your best 3rd and 4th column perks, though you can opt into Swashbuckler. Recommended MW: Stability or Range.
data.name: Cartesian Coordinate

data.description: This Scout offers insane range. Rifle Scope SSF will allow you to hit targets at 105m+, but this is never necessary so Red Dot Micro and Red Dot 2 MOA are fine. High Cal is nice, but you can also opt into Armor Piercing if using this against Barriers. Rapid Hit and Vorpal are your only real options in 3rd and 4th column, though you can also make OFA work I guess. Recommended MW: Handling
data.name: The Guiding Sight

data.description: Heavy GL's are not in a good spot right now, but this one still has some rolls that you can mess around with. Hard Launch is my go to barrel, with Quick Launch being my 2nd choice. Clown Cartridge or Field Prep is what you want here and you'd pair with Chain Reaction, Vorpal or Kill Clip for damage. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload.
data.name: Canis Major

data.description: Primarily used for Headstone, but Eyasluna does that job better tbh. Fluted / Hammerforged are my recommended Barrels and Accurized / Flared for Mags. Outlaw and Headstone for 3rd and 4th column. Recommended MW: Range or Handling.
data.name: Vulpecula

data.description: I don't see much use for this outside of Headstone shenanigans tbh as Machine Guns are not in a good spot overall. Arrowhead / Fluted are your go to Barrels and you'll want Accurized or Flared for your Mag. The choice between Stats For All, Perpetual Motion and Subsistence ends up being just preference tbh. I'd go with Stats For All though. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Recurrent Impact

data.description: Not many options on this bow, but Elastic String is your 1st choice and Polymer as 2nd choice. Fiberglass is your go to Arrow with Straight Fletching as your 2nd option. Archer's Tempo and Frenzy are your main options for PvE. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Accuracy.
data.name: Imperial Needle

data.description: DPS Version
data.name: Uzume RR4

data.description: Casual use version
data.name: Uzume RR4

data.description: Not usually my go to Pulse, but with Stats for All and One For All combination this suddenly got potential. Arrowhead / Fluted is preferred Barrels and you'll either want Flared Magwell or Accurized for Mag. While this used to be a somewhat lackluster gun for PvE, with the addition of Stats for All it became a lot better. Recommended MW: Range.
data.name: Forge's Pledge
